description: A shutDownNotification is sent for the reboot command.
This variable contains a printable octet
string that contains the origin and timestamp
of system reboot.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsysRestartMsg

description: A userAccessNotification is sent when a user logs in
successfully.
This variable contains a printable octet
string that contains the origin and timestamp
for system login.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsysLoginMsg

description: A userAccessNotification is sent when a user logs off.
This variable contains a printable octet
string that contains the origin and timestamp
for system logout.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsysLogoutMsg

description: A userAccessNotification is sent when a user login fails.
This variable contains a printable octet
string that contains the origin and timestamp
for system login failure.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsysLoginFailMsg

description: An Enterprise Authentication Failure Notification is sent when authentication fails for reasons like username/password/Ipaddress mismatch.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYSTEM-MIB::nnauthenticationFailureNotification SYSTEM-MIB::nnprotocolType i 1 SYSTEM-MIB::nnclientIpAddress s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nntimeStamp s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nnreasonForFailure i 1

description: This variable contains a protocol type for dfferent types of login failure.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnprotocolType

description: This variable contains a client Ip address from where the session request comes from.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnclientIpAddress

description: This variable contains a printable octet
string that contains timestamp
for system login failure.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nntimeStamp

description: This variable contains reason for failure like username password ipaddress shared key, preshared key, id
(future enhancements for SSh,telnet (Radius,tacacs) VPN security
current implementation takes only 2 values usename and password.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnreasonForFailure

description: An Enterprise Authentication Login Success Notification is sent when authentication succeeds for reasons like username/password/Ipaddress matches.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYSTEM-MIB::nnauthenticationLoginSuccessNotification SYSTEM-MIB::nnprotocolType i 1 SYSTEM-MIB::nnclientIpAddress s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nntimeStamp s EXAMPLE

description: This variable contains a protocol type for dfferent types of login failure.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnprotocolType

description: This variable contains a client Ip address from where the session request comes from.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnclientIpAddress

description: This variable contains a printable octet
string that contains timestamp
for system login failure.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nntimeStamp

description: On successful Logout, an Enterprise Logout Notification is generated
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYSTEM-MIB::nnlogoutNotification SYSTEM-MIB::nnprotocolType i 1 SYSTEM-MIB::nnclientIpAddress s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nntimeStamp s EXAMPLE

description: This variable contains a protocol type for dfferent types of login failure.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnprotocolType

description: This variable contains a client Ip address from where the session request comes from.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnclientIpAddress

description: This variable contains a printable octet
string that contains timestamp
for system login failure.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nntimeStamp

description: A sntpNotification is sent when an sntp client
is enabled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpEnableNotification SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout i 9999

description: The IP address or host name of an SNTP/NTP server.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr

description: The timeout value for the sntp client.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout

description: A sntpNotification is sent when an sntp client
is disabled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpDisableNotification SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout i 9999

description: The IP address or host name of an SNTP/NTP server.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr

description: The timeout value for the sntp client.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout

description: A sntpSuccessNotification is sent when an sntp client
is successful in receiving time from the server.

event.Summary: SNTP client successfully received time from server $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpSuccessNotification SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout i 9999

description: The IP address or host name of an SNTP/NTP server.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr

description: The timeout value for the sntp client.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout

description: A sntpErrorNotification is sent when an sntp client
has error in receiving time from the server.

event.Summary: SNTP client has error in receiving time from server $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpErrorNotification SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr s EXAMPLE SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout i 9999

description: The IP address or host name of an SNTP/NTP server.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpServerAddr

description: The timeout value for the sntp client.
It can be set only when set along with the
sntpClieenabled object.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnsntpTimeout

description: Trap being generated when ssm switches from Normal mode.
Current State of SSM.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnssmCurrentState

description: Trap being generated when ssm switches to Normal mode.
Previous State of SSM.
variables.name: SYSTEM-MIB::nnssmPreviousState
